question: Which Indian men's bridge pair have created history by clinching India's first-ever gold in bridge at the Asian Games?
explanation: Pranab Bardhan (60) and Shibnath Sarkar (56) have created history by clinching India\'s first-ever gold in bridge at the Asian Games. They finished at the top after scoring 384 points in the final of the men\'s bridge pair event at the  2018 Jakarta Asian Games. The Chinese pair of Lixin Yang and Gang Chen won the silver with a score of 378 and the Indonesian combination of Henky Lasut and Freddy Eddy Manoppo bagged the bronze scoring 374 here. The card game has been featured as a sport at the Asian Games for the first time, in the 2018 edition.
